title: 'Whatever it takes': TTU storms back in OT thriller
content: Darrion Williams scored the tiebreaking basket with 7.3 seconds left in overtime as Texas Tech rallied from a 16-point deficit to beat Arkansas 85-83 and earn a spot in the Elite Eight.

title: Duke back in Elite 8 behind Flagg's 30-point clinic
content: Duke's Cooper Flagg put on a skills clinic against Arizona, finishing with 30 points, 6 rebounds, 7 assists and 3 blocks Thursday night in a 100-93 win. The Blue Devils are in the Elite Eight for the second straight season.

title: 'Special moment': Giddey's 47-footer stuns Lakers
content: Josh Giddey heaved a buzzer-beating 47-foot 3-pointer from half court to cap perhaps the wildest finish in the NBA this season, giving the Chicago Bulls a 119-117 victory over the Los Angeles Lakers on Thursday night.

title: Dani Alves sexual assault conviction overturned
content: The top court in Spain's Catalonia region said on Friday it had overturned the conviction of Brazilian soccer player Dani Alves for sexual assault.

title: Terps' Willard unsure of future after tourney exit
content: Maryland men's basketball coach Kevin Willard was noncommittal about his future with the Terrapins after they were eliminated by Florida on Thursday in the Sweet 16.

title: With game on line, Soto whiffs to end Mets debut
content: Juan Soto had a chance to deliver tying runs in his much-anticipated Mets debut on Thursday, but he struck out swinging with two outs in the ninth inning to end the Astros' 3-1 win.

title: Arenado soaks in emotional post-HR curtain call
content: Nolan Arenado's eighth-inning homer Thursday had plenty of extra meaning after he spent much of the offseason on the trading block, and Cardinals fans knew it, bringing him out for a curtain call.

title: Ex-Vols coach Pruitt sues NCAA, seeking $100M
content: Former Tennessee football coach Jeremy Pruitt has filed a lawsuit against the NCAA seeking $100 million and claims it conspired with the university to make him a "sacrificial lamb."

title: SGA or Jokic for MVP? Answering the biggest NBA awards questions
content: Our insiders break down the biggest NBA awards questions, including the MVP battle between Nikola Jokic and Shai Gilgeous-Alexander.

title: 3-pointer problem? Why the NBA has no qualms with it -- yet
content: This season has seen a historic number of 3-point attempts. But does the league really need to rein in the 3s?

title: Inside Elic Ayomanor's viral night and journey from Canada to the NFL draft
content: From Medicine Hat, Alberta, the Stanford receiver came along way to a record night against Travis Hunter and his NFL future.

title: 2025 MLB predictions: From playoffs and World Series to MVPs and Cy Youngs
content: Can the Dodgers repeat? Who will win MVP? Our experts make their predictions for the 2025 baseball season.

title: Ranking the 25 best players in the women's Sweet 16: From Betts and Bueckers to Strong and Van Lith﻿
content: Does Paige Bueckers, Lauren Betts or Hannah Hidalgo takes over the top spot in our Sweet 16 player rankings?

title: How effects of Michigan hacking are rippling nationwide
content: The allegations have left much of college athletics concerned about what other athletes might be victims.

title: Barça vent anger over schedule as Olmo injured
content: Barcelona coach Hansi Flick said his team paid a "high price" for beating Osasuna 3-0 after losing Dani Olmo to injury in a game they were forced to play on Thursday.

title: UEFA to investigate Mbappé, Vini over Atleti game
content: Four Real Madrid players, including Kylian Mbappé and Vinícius Júnior, are being investigated for alleged "indecent conduct" during the Champions League game at Atlético Madrid, UEFA said on Thursday.

title: Ronaldo to lead CONMEBOL anti-racism task force
content: CONMEBOL announced on Thursday that Ronaldo Nazario will lead a task force to combat racism and violence in South American soccer.

title: Madrid-linked Alonso: Nothing to decide on future
content: In contrast to a year ago, Bayer Leverkusen coach Xabi Alonso has no offers from rival clubs to prompt any immediate decisions on his future.

title: Source: PSG owners finalizing Málaga purchase
content: Qatar Sport Investment (QSI), the owner of Paris Saint-Germain, are finalising the purchase of the Spanish club Malaga, a source has confirmed to ESPN.

title: Bompastor hails Chelsea's 'perfect night' in UWCL
content: Chelsea manager Sonia Bompastor hailed a "perfect night" as her side beat Manchester City to progress to a third-successive Champions League semifinal.

title: Source: City pausing on Echeverri future decision
content: Manchester City are set to wait until the summer before making a decision on Claudio Echeverri's future, a source has told ESPN.

title: Davies' agent slams Canada staff over ACL tear
content: Alphonso Davies' agent hit out at the player's treatment by Canada after it was announced that he has suffered a torn ACL against the United States.

title: Who's leading the Golden Boot races in Europe's top leagues?
content: Here are the players on top of the Premier League, LaLiga, Bundesliga, Serie A and Ligue 1 scoring charts.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Atlético star Antoine Griezmann eyes MLS in 2026
content: Antoine Griezmann plans to stay at Atlético Madrid, pushing a potential MLS move to 2026. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: 'I feel like I have everything in front of me': Inside the $765 million marriage of Juan Soto and the Mets
content: After a free agent megadeal that rocked the offseason, a new era begins for the Mets, New York and all of MLB.

title: We answered the biggest college softball questions: POY, WCWS picks and sleepers
content: Our experts answered the biggest college softball questions at midseason. Which teams still have a lot to prove?

title: A pair of Queens: Maryland star Derik Queen signs NIL deal with Dairy Queen
content: The star center helped the Terrapins advance to the Sweet 16 when his buzzer-beater lifted Maryland past Colorado State in the round of 32.

title: What the numbers tell us about Mayer vs. Ryan and Zepeda vs. Farmer
content: Two rematches on Saturday, one in Las Vegas, one in Mexico -- here's a look at the fights through the numbers.

title: Mikaela Mayer-Sandy Ryan rivalry explained: All you need to know
content: Ahead of their rematch on Saturday, we look at the Mayer vs. Ryan feud, the paint incident, and more.

title: 2025 preview: Skip Holtz looks to keep Birmingham on top, Bob Stoops takes aim
content: The UFL season kicks off Friday night, with every team looking to mount a challenge to Birmingham's dominance.

title: 7.7-Magnitude Earthquake Hits Myanmar, Strong Tremors In Bangkok, 20 Dead
content: Two large earthquakes - 7.7 and 6.4 magnitude - struck central Myanmar Friday morning, causing tremors as far away as northern Thailand, with reports also coming in of tremors in China.

title: Myanmar Earthquake Live: Many Feared Dead In Varsity Fire, Say Reports
content: Myanmar, Thailand Earthquake Live Updates: A powerful earthquake rattled Myanmar and neighbouring Thailand, trapping dozens of workers in a collapsed under-construction skyscraper in Bangkok where a state of emergency was declared.

title: Indian Man Was At Daughter's Bangkok School. Then Massive Earthquake Hit
content: Thailand Earthquake: When the ground began to tremble violently beneath his feet, Prem Kishore Mohanty from India was sitting in the auditorium of his daughter's school in Thailand's Bangkok.

title: Centre Okays Transfer Of Judge In Cash-At-Home Row To Allahabad High Court
content: The Centre today confirmed the Supreme Court collegium's decision to transfer Delhi High Court judge Justice Yashwant Varma, who is in the middle of an alleged cash stash row, to the Allahabad High Court.

title: Panic In Myanmar, Bangkok As Buildings Collapse, Airport Damaged In Quake
content: Collapsed bridges and buildings, shaking skyscrapers with water from infinity pools falling hundreds of feet to the ground - scenes that followed a big 7.7 earthquake in central Myanmar that led to tremors in northern Bangkok and southwestern China.

title: Centre Raises Dearness Allowance For Union Government Employees By 2%
content: In a salary increase for central government employees ahead of the 8th Pay Commission, the Union cabinet approved a 2 per cent increase in dearness allowance.

title: Bengaluru Techie Kills Wife, Stuffs Body in Suitcase, Then Attempts Suicide
content: A 36-year-old tech professional in Bengaluru allegedly murdered his wife and stuffed it into a suitcase before fleeing to Pune, where he later attempted suicide.

title: Kunal Kamra Jokes On Why Narayana Murthy Likes Working 70 Hours A Week
content: Stand-up comedian Kunal Kamra humorously criticises Sudha Murthy's "simple" lifestyle and explains why Narayana Murthy prefers to work 70 hours a week.

title: "When Life Gives You Lemons...": Kunal Kamra Roasts Anand Mahindra
content: Stand-up comedian Kunal Kamra, at the centre of a massive controversy over his parody of Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde, is viral again on social media; this time for his bit on industrialist Anand Mahindra.

title: Putin Calls For Zelensky's Removal As Ukraine Negotiations Face Uncertainty
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin has upped the ante in the negotiations to end the war in Ukraine. Going straight for the head, he has called for Zelensky's removal as Ukraine's President and instead, put in place a "transitional administration".

title: 1,000-Bed Myanmar Hospital Is "Mass Casualty Area" After 7.7 Earthquake
content: A 1000-bed hospital in Myanmar capital Naypyidaw is a likely "mass casualty area", news agency AFP said Friday afternoon after a 7.7 earthquake struck near the city of Sagaing.

title: MS Dhoni Craze Harming CSK? Rayudu Says, "Internally, Lot Of People..."
content: MS Dhoni is no less than a god-like figure for CSK fans, but this "weird" obsession can sometimes go out of hands.

title: "If You Are Under 40, Leave UK": Woman's Video On Wealth Outflow Goes Viral
content: A video by influencer 'Prudishfish' advising young people to leave the UK due to wealth outflow and rising living costs has gone viral.

title: 'Yeshu Yeshu Prophet' Bajinder Singh Found Guilty In 2018 Rape Case
content: Punjab's self-styled Christian pastor Bajinder Singh, who is popularly known as 'Yeshu Yeshu prophet', was on Friday convicted in a 2018 rape case.

title: "India Ready To Offer Assistance": PM Modi On Myanmar, Thailand Earthquake
content: Concerned by the earthquake situation in Myanmar and Thailand, India is ready to offer assistance, says PM Modi.

title: BCCI Contracts: No Demotion For Rohit, Kohli; Report Says Kishan's Case...
content: BCCI Central Contracts: According to reports, the BCCI is set to convene a meeting on Saturday with BCCI secretary Devajit Saikia and India head coach Gautam Gambhir in attendance

title: MLB season: Power Rankings, playoff odds and everything you need for all 30 team
content: 28 of the 30 MLB teams take the field for opening day on Thursday . we asked our MLB experts to rank every team from 1 to 30 in our first Power Rankings of the new season . a breakdown of what to expect this season, along with the win-loss projections and playoff odds for all 30 teams .

title: Your guide to Day 1 of the men's Sweet 16: High-scoring games, OT and more
content: the red Raiders beat Arkansas 85-83 in OT How Texas Tech won: For most of the second half, Arkansas looked like it was cruising to the Elite Eight in its first season under John Calipari . Texas Tech's darrion Williams drops in a clutch, go-ahead layup late in overtime . the first half of the elite eight is set .

title: 'Richie's Tater Shots': BYU's Saunders signs NIL deal with company founded by great-grandfather
content: richie Saunders poured in 25 points for the Cougars against the Wisconsin Badgers in the round of 32 . he founded frozen foods company Ore-Ida in the 1950s . the company's great-grandfather founded the company to ink a partnership with the forward .

title: The mercurial backcourt motoring Notre Dame's March Madness
content: the top plays this season are from Hannah Hidalgo, Olivia Miles and Sonia Citron . the trio in the backcourt combined for 61 points, 18 rebounds, 12 assists and 10 steals . last year's WNBA was the second-ranked women's team in the country .

title: For Notre Dame and Marcus Freeman, writing a different ending is the final step
content: a traditional stadium walk took on a new feel for the first college football playoff game . the crowd swelled and the stadium lights popped in the distance . "it was almost like being in a movie as you're walking to the stadium," Freeman says .

title: One room, 300 clubs, 80 agencies, 3,500 meetings: Inside soccer's secret transfer space
content: players clubs are most itching to sign from the transferRoom meeting in Berlin . there are owners, general managers, sporting directors and scouts, agents and data analysts . players clubs and representatives of more than 80 agencies are gathered to talk transfers .

title: Logos, coaches, key players and more
content: eight teams will play a 10-game season that culminates in a championship game on June 14 . the game will culminate with a game on march 28 between the St. Louis Battlehawks and Houston Roughnecks . here's a handy cheat sheet on the UFL basics .

title: Myanmar earthquake: Videos capture collapsing buildings, cracked roads, and mass panic
content: A 7.7-magnitude earthquake struck Myanmar, causing extensive damage and panic in Thailand and China. The tremor, followed by a significant aftershock, destroyed buildings, collapsed a bridge, and damaged infrastructure. Rescue operations are underway as people fled to safety, and emergency teams assess the situation amid warnings of possible aftershocks and further collapses.

title: Cabinet approves 2% DA hike for central govt employees
content: The Union Cabinet, led by PM Narendra Modi, approved a 2% increase in Dearness Allowance and Dearness Relief for Central Government employees and pensioners, effective January 1, 2025. The rate rise from 53% to 55% aims to combat inflation, impacting over 115 lakh individuals, with costs estimated at Rs 6,614.04 crore annually.

title: Cash-at-home row: Centre confirms transfer of Justice Yashwant Varma to Allahabad HC
content: The government has transferred Justice Yashwant Varma from Delhi High Court to Allahabad High Court amid allegations of cash discovery at his residence following a fire. Justice Varma denied the claims, and a Supreme Court in-house committee is investigating the matter. A PIL for an FIR was dismissed, as the inquiry is still ongoing.

title: Did You Know? RCB have won at Chepauk vs CSK only once in IPL history
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) aim to break a 17-year winless streak against Chennai Super Kings (CSK) at MA Chidambaram Stadium on Friday. With CSK's spin-friendly conditions and a strong bowling lineup, RCB’s batting, led by Virat Kohli, faces a tough challenge. This crucial match tests RCB's determination to overcome history and the Chepauk curse.

title: How to create Ghibli-style Portraits without paying for ChatGPT Plus
content: OpenAI's new GPT-4o update has sparked a trend of Studio Ghibli-style portraits, exclusive to select ChatGPT subscription tiers. Despite the delay in the free-tier rollout, users can create similar artworks using free alternatives like Gemini, GrokAI, Craiyon, Artbreeder, and various premium platforms offering free trials.

title: 'Mass casualty' earthquake rattles Myanmar: What we know so far
content: A massive 7.7 magnitude earthquake hit Myanmar and Thailand, causing significant damage and panic. In Bangkok, under construction building collapsed, trapping 43 workers. In Myanmar, a major hospital has been converted into a mass casualty area. Both countries are experiencing widespread damage and disruption.

title: 'Even Indira Gandhi couldn't do it': What Jaishankar said on Pak mindset
content: External affairs minister S Jaishankar informed the Lok Sabha that India is closely monitoring minority attacks in Pakistan and Bangladesh. He highlighted recent incidents targeting Hindus, Sikhs, Ahmadis, and Christians. Jaishankar stressed India's inability to change Pakistan's mindset but affirmed proactive measures to address the issue. The Human Rights Focus Pakistan report noted a rise in minority attacks in 2025.

title: 'Nothing new with Eden Gardens curator not listening to home captain'
content: Ex-Bengal cricketer Shreevats Goswami claimed Eden Gardens curator consistently ignores home team requests. The current curator refuted accusations, emphasising adherence to BCCI guidelines and maintaining good relations with KKR. Simon Doull called for prioritising home team needs. KKR captain Rahane desired spin-friendly pitches, but Mukherjee defended his pitch preparations and questioned KKR’s spinners’ performance.

title: 15 hr-plus Raid on Amazon, Flipkart warehouses: Products with fake ISI mark seized
content: BIS conducted raids on Amazon and Flipkart warehouses in Delhi and Tamil Nadu, confiscating thousands of substandard products lacking mandatory ISI marks. Items worth approximately Rs 70 lakh and Rs 36 lakh were seized from Amazon and Flipkart, respectively. The raids are part of a nationwide initiative to ensure compliance with quality standards and protect consumers.

title: Karti P Chidambaram meets PM Modi to raise alarm over stray dog crisis
content: Congress leader Karti P Chidambaram met with PM Narendra Modi to address the rising concerns over India's stray dog population and rabies-related deaths. He urged for the creation of a National Task Force and highlighted the need for improved resources and technology to manage the situation more effectively.

title: ‘Yeshu Yeshu’ Pastor Bajinder Singh convicted in 2018 sexual harassment case
content: Bajinder Singh, a self-proclaimed Christian pastor, was convicted by a Mohali court for sexual harassment charges from 2018. The verdict followed his non-bailable warrant and arrest in 2018. Singh faced similar accusations in a separate case. A recent video showing him slapping individuals is being investigated by authorities. Singh has faced multiple legal issues previously.

title: Vaughan pokes fun at IPL: 'A strategic time-out with 2 needed'
content: Former England captain Michael Vaughan humorously criticised the IPL for a seemingly unnecessary strategic timeout during a match where Lucknow Super Giants needed just two runs off 24 balls. The decision raised eyebrows and was a moment of amusement amidst LSG's comfortable victory over Sunrisers Hyderabad.

title: ChatGPT updated Ghibli-style photos policy, now users cannot modify these photos
content: OpenAI's updated policy restricts creating Studio Ghibli-style photos from real-world images on ChatGPT. The change addresses concerns about using artists' work without permission. OpenAI is refining its policies based on user feedback and high demand has delayed the rollout of its image tool to free users. This follows Google's similar AI image feature release.

title: Solar Eclipse 2025: Date, time in India and its significance
content: In 2025, India will experience two solar eclipses, one in March and another in September. The first event will be a partial eclipse, while the second will showcase a mesmerizing 'Ring of Fire'. Scientists and space enthusiasts prepare for these cosmic occurrences, while many in India continue to follow traditional rituals and customs during eclipses.

title: Watch: Sports presenter smashes TV in rage over Pant's IPL performance
content: During a live broadcast, a presenter on an Indian sports YouTube channel lost his temper over Lucknow Super Giants skipper Rishabh Pant's IPL 2025 performance, damaging studio equipment. Pant's form in the opening matches, including a six-ball duck and a run-a-ball 15, has left fans and analysts frustrated despite LSG's recent win.

title: 'India stands ready to offer assistance': PM Modi on Myanmar, Thailand quake
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi expressed deep concern over the devastating earthquakes in Myanmar and Thailand, which caused significant destruction, including the collapse of a high-rise building in Bangkok. He assured that India is prepared to provide all possible assistance and has directed authorities to remain on standby. Emergency response efforts are underway in both countries.

title: 'I've never differentiated between Yuvraj & Dhoni': Yograj Singh
content: Former cricketer Yograj Singh, known for his outspoken views, asserted on a podcast that he never differentiates between his son Yuvraj and players like MS Dhoni. He defended struggling stars Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli, suggesting he could reinvigorate the Indian team if made its coach. Previously, he had criticized Dhoni for ending Yuvraj's career prematurely.

title: Watch: Bangkok under construction building crumbles after strong earthquake
content: A powerful 7.7 magnitude earthquake struck Myanmar on Friday, affecting areas like Bangkok and China's Yunnan province. There were no immediate reports of damage or casualties. An under-construction structure collapsed, causing debris clouds. Thai Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra cut short her visit to Phuket due to the situation.

title: Restaurants can't force customers to pay service charge: Delhi HC
content: The Delhi high court declared that service charges on food bills remain discretionary, dismissing restaurant associations' petitions against Central Consumer Protection Authority's rules. The CCPA guidelines ensure hotels and restaurants cannot automatically add or compel the payment of service charges, emphasizing consumer choice and transparency.

title: Thief flew to Kolkata for rasgullas, Goa for scotch, caught in Gujarat
content: Vikas Namdev, a 26-year-old from Madhya Pradesh, funded his lavish lifestyle through theft. He was apprehended by Vadodara police for stealing gold ornaments worth Rs 34 lakh from female passengers on trains between Vadodara and Surat. Namdev posed as a textile businessman to avoid suspicion.

title: Fire breaks out at Greater Noida girls' hostel; students leap from balconies to escape
content: A fire erupted at the Annapurna Girls Hostel in Greater Noida, with students leaping from balconies to escape. The fire, caused by an air conditioner's compressor explosion, led to no casualties. The fire department promptly managed the situation, ensuring no students were trapped inside. Videos captured the dramatic escape efforts of the hostel's residents.

title: How jeweller foiled robbery bid in Palghar using bamboo sticks — Video
content: Jeweller Rupsingh Dasana thwarted an armed robbery at Mamta Jewellers in Saphale, Palghar late Thursday night. The robbers, one armed, fled after firing a shot, damaging the store's glass. Police arrived on the scene, recovering evidence, and registered a case at Saphale police station.

title: 'Find the right balance': Ex-cricketer on BCCI's family time SOP
content: Former national selector Saba Karim highlights the need for a balance in the BCCI's policy on family time for players during overseas tours, addressing concerns over its rigidity. Virat Kohli emphasises the emotional benefits of having family around, citing the psychological support family presence brings. The BCCI aims to maintain focus on cricket while considering players’ needs.

title: Security tightened in Sambhal for last Friday prayers of Ramzan: Key points
content: Heavy security was deployed in Sambhal, Uttar Pradesh, ahead of 'Alvida Juma' due to ongoing tensions related to a dispute over the Mughal-era Jama Masjid since November 2024. Guidelines were issued for offering prayers, and compliance was emphasized to prevent further unrest.

title: Tendulkar joins Ghibli AI trend, brings 2011 WC glory to life
content: Sachin Tendulkar shared AI-generated images of India's 2011 World Cup victory in Studio Ghibli style. He posted the unique reimagining on his official X account, blending sports nostalgia with artistic flair. The images of Tendulkar lifting the trophy and being carried by teammates quickly went viral, drawing excitement and nostalgic responses from fans.

title: Watch: Building collapses, people flee in panic as powerful quake hits Bangkok
content: A powerful 7.7 magnitude earthquake, with its epicenter in central Myanmar, shook Bangkok at 1:30 pm, causing alarms to go off and prompting evacuations in high-rise buildings. No immediate reports of damage or casualties were available, but Thai Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra held an urgent meeting in response to the temblor. The region remains on alert.

title: Watch: Anti-terror operation resumes in J&K Kathua’s remote forests
content: Security forces engaged in fresh gunfire with terrorists in Jammu and Kashmir's Kathua district. The encounter follows Thursday's clash, which led to the deaths of three J&K policemen and three suspected Pakistani terrorists. Advanced surveillance tools and reinforcements have been deployed as the operation continues.

title: Meerut murder fallout? Man ‘marries off’ wife to her lover in UP
content: Bablu Kori, an electrician from Sant Kabir Nagar, took an unexpected path when he discovered his wife, Radhika, was having an affair with Vikas Kumar. Instead of reacting with anger, he facilitated their marriage at a local temple, ensuring a smooth process. Bablu decided to care for his children and wished Radhika happiness.

title: Shinde Joke row: Kunal Kamra moves HC seeking transit anticipatory bail
content: Kunal Kamra has filed for transit anticipatory bail in Madras High Court following an FIR for allegedly disparaging remarks about Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde in a comedy show. Kamra claims the charges are false and is seeking protection against arrest, citing threats to his safety.

title: IPL: Can CSK continue to dominate RCB at Chepauk?
content: Chennai Super Kings face Royal Challengers Bengaluru in a high-stakes match at MA Chidambaram Stadium on Friday. The rivalry is fueled by past encounters and regional proximity. CSK's dominance since 2008 is threatened by RCB's determination led by Virat Kohli and captain Rajat Patidar. CSK's concern is Pathirana's injury, impacting their bowling strength.

title: Chennai tech honcho moves HC alleging police harassing him at wife's behest
content: Prasanna Sankaranarayanan, co-founder of Rippling, sought protection from the Madras High Court claiming police harassment influenced by his estranged wife. The court has directed police to refrain from harassing him. Prasanna accuses his wife of filing false cases amid their custody dispute over their son.

title: Happy Eid-ul-Fitr 2025: 51 inspiring Eid Mubarak wishes and messages
content: Eid-ul-Fitr marks the end of Ramadan and is celebrated with gratitude, prayer, and generosity towards the needy. Muslims worldwide come together to offer special prayers, enjoy festive meals, and exchange gifts. This year, it will be observed from the evening of March 31, 2025, to April 1, 2025.

title: IPL: 'Big relief' for LSG captain Rishabh Pant
content: Shardul Thakur was roped in by Lucknow Super Giants as a replacement for Mohsin Khan in the IPL 2025, and he delivered with a match-winning 4 for 34 against Sunrisers Hyderabad. Nicholas Pooran led the run-chase with 70 runs off 26 balls. Thakur called for more balanced pitches favoring both bowlers and batters.

title: 'Ramadan Mubarak': Trump hosts Iftar dinner at White House; watch video
content: US President Donald Trump hosted the annual Iftar dinner at the White House, expressing gratitude to Muslim-Americans for their support in the November 2024 elections. He highlighted the importance of Ramadan and emphasized his administration's efforts for peace in the Middle East amid ongoing conflicts.

title: Watch: Pikachu seen fleeing police during anti-Erdogan protests in Turkey
content: Protests erupted in Istanbul following the detention of Mayor Ekrem Imamoglu on corruption allegations, leading to widespread unrest and nearly 1,900 detentions. Demonstrators, including one in a Pikachu costume, were seen clashing with the police, as international concerns over Turkey's democratic decline grow.

title: Watch: Bengal CM Mamata heckled by student protesters at Oxford University
content: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee spoke at Oxford University on women's empowerment in Bengal, but was interrupted by students protesting post-poll violence and a controversial case. She emphasized the importance of unity and inclusive development while addressing accusations and challenges raised during her speech.

title: 100-plus women share their longevity secrets and it NOT diet or exercise
content: One of the women, who was 100 years old, when asked what is the secret to being 100, said, "Do everything wrong, don't have diet coke, have regular coke, don't exercise, and most importantly, don't worry". She further went on to add that she likes coffee, has ice cream 'all the time', and still drinks alcohol.

title: Expert picks, best bets: Moreno's path to victory over Erceg at UFC Fight Night
content: Brandon Moreno makes his first Octagon appearance of 2025 . the former two-time men's flyweight champion takes on Steve Erceg . moreno, no. 3 in the divisional rankings, lost the title to Alexandre Pantoja in July 2023 .

title: Cabinet announces ₹6,282 crore Kosi Mechi intra-state river link in Bihar
content: At the Cabinet briefing, Ashwini Vaishnaw also announced the approval of the four lane Patna-Arrah-Sasaram highway corridor project

title: Kunal Kamra moves Madras High Court seeking inter-State anticipatory bail
content: The stand-up comedian, who is a resident of Tamil Nadu since 2021, has told the high court that he did not name Eknath Shinde in his ‘Naya Bharat’ comedy show.

title: Free cardiac surgery services for children at Hyderabad’s NIMS
content: Children from other States can also avail of the service if they have an Aadhaar card issued in Telangana or Andhra Pradesh

title: Cash discovery row: Justice Varma transferred to Allahabad High Court
content: Earlier, the Allahabad High Court Bar Association began an indefinite strike to protest against the proposed transfer of Delhi High Court Justice Yashwant Varma to the Allahabad High Court

title: Union Cabinet announces ₹22,919 crore electronics component manufacturing scheme
content: Capacitors, inductors, resistors and connectors will be manufactured in the country, said Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw

title: Drug bust at Payyannur in Kerala’s Kannur; three arrested with 166.68 grams of MDMA
content: Acting on a tip-off, police raid a lodge room where an accused was staying. A total of 108.5 grams of MDMA was recovered from his bag in the cupboard, while the rest was found in the pockets of the other two accused

title: Bangladesh welcomes China to participate in Teesta project; ‘Taiwan inalienable part of China,’ Yunus gives ‘firm commitment’
content: “The two sides agreed to promote high-quality Belt and Road cooperation, strengthen international cooperation on industrial and supply chains and work together to achieve modernization in both countries,” the Joint Statement announced

title: Kerala HC dismisses pleas seeking probe against CM, daughter on CMRL-Exalogic transactions
content: HC had earlier issued notice to Pinarayi Vijayan, his daughter on a petition filed by Congress MLA which challenged the order of special court of Vigilance and Anti-Corruption Bureau that dismissed his plea

title: Nepalese woman's death in KIIT: NHRC seeks action taken report from Odisha Government, UGC, NAAC
content: “During the visit, the NHRC team found that the deceased woman had lodged a complaint with KIIT’s International Relations Office, months before taking the extreme step,” the Commission said

title: Restaurants cannot enforce service charge, violates consumer rights: Delhi HC
content: The guidelines issued by CCPA, stated that hotels or restaurant cannot add service charge automatically or by default in the food bill

title: APMRC to execute Vijayawada, Vizag metro railway projects in EPC mode by engaging general consultants
content: The Board also decided not to appoint an executing agency in view of the high cost and certain other disadvantages, APMRC Managing Director said

title: Social justice, women empowerment at the centre of T.N.’s inclusive development, says CM Stalin
content: He was addressing the Confederation of Indian Industries (CII) South India Annual Convention 2025, organised with the theme, ‘Infra South: Crafting Livable Environment in India Cities’

title: Vazhndhu Kattuvom 3.0 will be implemented in 120 blocks with World Bank assistance: Udhayanidhi
content: Mr. Udhayanidhi said the State government will implement a skill development programme to train 42,000 youth to get jobs and become entrepreneurs, at a cost of ₹66 crore

title: Gang of three hailing from Guntur arrested in ‘digital arrest’ scam
content: The accused had links to similar fraud cases across India, including incidents in Delhi, Uttar Pradesh, Tamil Nadu, Kerala and Chhattisgarh

title: Debating the problem of colourism in Kerala’s progressive society
content: Chief Secretary Sarada Muraleedharan’s post on colourism evokes fierce discussions on how people are discriminated on the basis of skin tone

title: Watch: How serious is Kerala’s drug crisis?
content: Kerala now leads the country in drug-related cases, far ahead of states like Punjab and Maharashtra. The numbers are also far too high to be explained by good policing alone.

title: Jadavpur University V-C removed after Governor’s order
content: The directive comes after month-long protests kept the campus on the boil and authorities on their toes

title: Electoral battle in 2026 in T.N. will only be between TVK and DMK: Vijay
content: He alleged the ruling dispensation in the State has been causing trouble for TVK in organising conferences, meetings, and outreach programmes over the past year

title: Priyanka Gandhi Vadra says ‘we owe it to soldiers for protecting our freedom’
content: In Wayanad, Priyanka Gandhi says martyrs’ memorials are reminders that ‘whatever we have today has come at a cost and there are people who sacrificed a lot for it’

title: J. Varma case: SC says CJI can opt to refer to Parliament for removal or sanction registration of FIR based on results of in-house probe
content: When asked why an FIR was not registered in neither the incident of fire nor the alleged finding of the money, the SC said today is not the time for an FIR, when the inquiry is still going on

title: Gig workers’ union welcomes Union Home Minister-announced Sahkar Taxi
content: TGPWU will closely monitor the rollout of ‘Sahkar Taxi’ and engage with the government, said Shaik Salauddin

title: When three pillars of democracy work together, good governance happens: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath
content: Yogi Adityanath said the youth should develop leadership skills and serve the nation by contributing to the three pillars

title: Contradiction in Telangana CM and Dy CM claims on loan repayment misled House: Harish Rao
content: While Deputy CM said ₹88,564 crore was spent to repay loans, CM claimed that ₹1,53,359 crore was paid towards debts and interest

title: Government to launch Ola, Uber-like ‘Sahkar’ taxi service: Amit Shah announces in Parliament
content: The government is likely to position the initiative as part of its broader ‘Sahkar se Samriddhi’ (Prosperity through Cooperation) mission.

title: Mohanlal-starrer ‘L2: Empuraan’ faces online backlash from right-wing supporters
content: Soon after release of the much-hyped movie, social media platforms were filled with messages calling for its boycott, with some users even posting images of online tickets they had cancelled after hearing about the film’s content

title: Farmer leader Dallewal breaks indefinite fast, accepts water: Punjab Government to SC
content: The top court asked the high-powered committee headed by a former High Court judge to look into the grievances of farmers, to also file a supplementary status report.

title: Former Karnataka police chief B.N. Garudachar passes away
content: In 1976, he was appointed the Commissioner of Bengaluru City Police, at a time when rowdy gangs operated with impunity, with political patronage

title: Detained Punjab farmer leaders Pandher, Kohar released
content: Kisan Mazdoor Morcha leader Mr. Pandher was released from Muktsar jail while Kohar, Kotra and some other farmer leaders were released from Patiala central jail, they said

title: Mamata Banerjee’s speech at Oxford disrupted, as protestors raise RG Kar issue
content: The United Kingdom (UK) unit of Students’ Federation of India took to social media and said that the protests were organised by them;  Mamata identifies the protesters as “left and ultra-left and communal friends”. “

title: Congress MP Pratapgarhi’s poem does not spread discord, rules SC as it calls for ‘reasonable’ restrictions on free speech
content: The court quashed a hate speech case registered by Gujarat Police against the Congress MP, noting that free speech was an integral part of a healthy and civilised society.

title: PM Modi to visit Thailand, Sri Lanka from April 3-6
content: It will be the Prime Minister Narendra Modi's third visit to Thailand, the Ministry of External Affairs said.

title: AIADMK legislators evicted en masse from Tamil Nadu Assembly
content: Soon after the Question Hour ended, AIADMK general secretary Edappadi Palaniswami stood up, saying he wanted to raise a matter of urgent public importance

title: Dutch delegation expresses interest in AI-powered health tech
content: The delegation expressed interest especially in labour-saving technologies in healthcare, innovations in pharmaceuticals with AI in drug development and discovery, and remote monitoring and telehealth related solutions as a screening method for medical triaging.

title: Protest against Waqf Bill LIVE: AIMPLB urges Muslims to wear black armband
content: The All India Muslim Personal Law Board (AIMPLB) announced a nationwide agitation against the Waqf (Amendment) Bill, 2024, with large sit-ins planned in front of the state assemblies in Patna and Vijayawada on March 26 and 29, respectively, as part of the first phase of the protest

title: Drug cases surge in Telangana by over 470% since 2017
content: Telangana recorded a five-fold rise in NDPS cases since 2017, with 2024 marking an all-time high; drug seizures and arrests continue into 2025 with early figures indicating sustained enforcement efforts

title: Commercial Taxes Department to collect profession tax in A.P. from April 1
content: Assesses should pay professional taxes to Commercial Taxes Department only by visiting website https://www.apct.gov.in

title: U.S. Justice Department sting singes Hyderabad-based manufacturer of Fentanyl intermediary
content: ‘Non-state groups are often enabled, both directly and indirectly, by state actors, such as China and India as sources of precursors and equipment for drug traffickers’

title: YSRCP, CPI(M) oppose A.P. govt.’s decision to allocate Harbour Park land in Vizag to LuLu Group
content: Botcha questions rationale behind providing prime land to private parties at cheaper prices; the land falls within the prohibited area of CRZ, says CPI(M) leader

title: Film producer Max Howard shares his observations on the evolution of the animation industry
content: Max is known for his extensive work in the animation industry, where he has served leadership positions at major studios such as Disney, Warner Bros., and DreamWorks

title: Silver for the goddess | Why Cuttack’s GI-tagged Tarakasi art form is facing a precarious future
content: March is when the Rupa Tarakasi craftsmen of Cuttack begin work for Durga Puja, but the artisans of this 500-year-old art form are struggling to stay afloat

title: Watch: AIADMK’s possible BJP alliance: What’s behind the political shift? | Focus Tamil Nadu
content: A crucial meeting between Edappadi K. Palaniswami and Amit Shah in Delhi has fueled speculation about a renewed alliance.

title: Severe heatwave alert for 89 mandals in Andhra Pradesh today
content: The Andhra Pradesh State Disaster Management Authority (APSDMA) has issued a ‘severe heatwave’ alert (red) for 89 mandals in the State on March 27 and for 36 mandals on March 28.

title: Anti-terrorist operation resumes in J&K’s Kathua; body of fourth cop sighted
content: After halting for the night, search parties moved from different directions with the first light of the day on March 28 in J&K’s Kathua

title: Story of mud and water | Review of Rising Sons by Kavery Nambisan
content: Set in a village in the years leading up to Independence, Nambisan’s new novel is about family dynamics and deeply ingrained societal divisions

title: In her Oxford address, Mamata says her governance model doesn't allow discrimination
content: Addressing a gathering at Kellogg College at the University of Oxford on March 27, 2025, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee stressed the importance of inclusive development and stated that division in society is counterproductive.

title: Death’s incomplete draft | Review of M. Mukundan’s novel You, translated by Nandakumar K.
content: The story featuring a septuagenarian protagonist develops as a mystery but the ending feels unsatisfactory

title: China rebuffs Trump offer of tariff concessions if Beijing agrees to TikTok deal
content: Trump told reporters at the White House on Wednesday that he could give China “a little reduction in tariffs or something to get it done”

title: Shivamogga zoo: Shifting focus to education and conservation
content: To motivate more people to adopt animals, the zoo is set to introduce ZooVista project in which visitors are taken on a 3D virtual tour of the facility in an air-conditioned unit

title: The flawed push for a third language
content: While students can study multiple languages privately, it’s not cost-effective to fund the teaching of more than two languages in public schools. When India’s schools struggle with basic proficiency in two languages, enforcing a third without any clear benefits is deeply flawed

title: Uncounted lives at tribal heartland in Andhra Pradesh
content: In the ASR District of Andhra Pradesh, hundreds of children are birthed at home in the tribal settlements deep in jungles and atop hills. Most of these children do not exist on government records and slip through welfare programmes aimed at their uplift. T. Appala Naidu visits a remote hamlet and finds a vulnerable community, whose next generation may miss out on opportunities support they rightly deserve

title: AAP’s Somnath Bharti challenges BJP’s Satish Upadhyay’s election before Delhi HC
content: Mr. Upadhyay defeated Mr Bharti by winning the Malviya Nagar seat in the capital with 39,564 votes in the Delhi assembly elections held in February.

title: Debt, despair and the dark side of online gambling in Telangana
content: Illegal online betting is spreading like wildfire, fuelled by instant loans, aggressive marketing and star-studded endorsements. Given weak enforcement, these platforms ensnare countless users, many of them young, trapping them in a relentless cycle of addiction and debt. While authorities scramble to rein them in, the industry thrives in the shadows, dodging regulations and accountability. Lavpreet Kaur and Naveen Kumar delve into the murky world of this high-stakes digital gamble

title: Bengaluru’s urban boom reshapes villages around it
content: Greater Bengaluru Governance Bill, 2024, proposes to add 24 urbanised villages around Bengaluru to the city’s civic limits. Shreyas H.S. The Hindu visits some of the villages to discover the contrasting realities there

title: Over 68% revolutionaries lodged in cellular prison were from undivided Bengal
content: The Ministry of Culture and Tourism reveals majority of revolutionaries at Andaman Cellular Jail were from Bengal, sparking debate on national monument status

title: BJP stages demonstration against Congress government in Himachal
content: BJP stages ‘Halla Bol’ rally in Shimla against Congress government’s alleged ‘mafia raj’ in Himachal Pradesh

title: Direct flights to start biweekly between Kolkata and London on Mamata’s request: Trinamool
content: A few days prior, the Chief Minister had appealed for a direct flight between Kolkata and London during her meeting with investors at the High Commission of India in London

title: Only 10 PVTGs given habitat rights under FRA in 14 districts of M.P., Odisha, Chhattisgarh
content: Internal MoTA draft report dated to 2020 reveals that many officials continue to confuse habitat rights with the provision of housing or other rights under community forest rights

title: BJP chief in West Bengal praises religious sect in search for votes
content: Prime Minister Modi also greeted the Matua Community on Matua Dharma Maha Mela 2025 and said that the event will showcase the glorious Matua community culture

title: The preacher pulling crowds with promises of healing and miracles
content: Allegations of sexual misconduct against Bajinder Singh, who calls himself a prophet, have not dented the faith of his followers in his Christian mission. They throng his sessions held in a field in Punjab, even as his 3.75-million subscriber base grows on YouTube, finds Vikas Vasudeva

title: Hospitality at the time of adversity
content: It is easy for reporters to become cynical, but every once in a while, people come along to reinforce their belief in humanity

title: Mandatory pregnancy registration sparks privacy concerns in Haryana
content: Order in potential conflict with the existing law on termination of pregnancy and may have unintended consequences, such as driving women to seek unsafe abortions outside the formal healthcare system

title: Reckless policies of LDF, UDF led to fiscal crisis in Kerala: Nirmala
content: Dismissing allegations that the Centre is not sanctioning sufficient funds for the State, the Union Minister says Kerala received ₹1.57 lakh crore between 2014 and 2024, which is an increase of 239% over the UPA period

title: Communal remarks on Mohanlal’s offering for Mammootty draw flak
content: Kerala Minority Welfare Minister V. Abdurahiman on Thursday condemned the statements made by certain individuals spreading communal venom regarding actor Mohanlal’s offering at the Sabarimala Ayyappa temple on behalf of actor Mammootty

title: U.S. tariffs: Opposition slams Centre’s ‘inaction’
content: How will the government tackle the issue, ask Rajya Sabha members; Chidambaram seeks discussion in Parliament; Finance Minister says recent reductions in duties are not in response to Trump’s announcements

title: New bridge over railway line in Polur will be ready for public use by April
content: The new bridge will be a lifeline for us as it will connect both sides of Polur town. Tribals from Jawadhu Hills can also easily reach the highway without negotiating traffic in the town, says a resisdent

title: Plea for police probe into Delhi HC judge residence fire to be heard on March 28
content: Petition in Supreme Court seeks FIR against Justice Yashwant Varma for “unaccounted money”, challenges jurisdiction of inquiry committee
